text: Hay 7e14 TTTHrif xifadrut TANV Phcne 91-11-26074100/25074200 (at YRast a TNTANf Aatora) Fax. 91-11-25093507 25093514 National Highways Authority of India (Ministry of Road Transport and Highways) #-6 Qa 6, 4az7-10, ana_ #8 fart-110075 6-5 & 6, Sector-10,Dwarka, New Delhi-110075 NHAI/ Policy Guidelines/Consultancy/2017 No. 10.1.17/ 2017 Dated, the June_ 2017 (Decision taken in 306* Meeting of Executive Committee vide Agenda item no. 306.10 placed by Punjab Division) Sub Acceptance of Single Tender for Consultancy Services -Clarification-reg: In supersession of Policy Matters (Technical) no. 190/2015 regarding acceptance of Single Tender for Consultancy Services, following has been decided: As for the bids for consulting assignments (viz DPR/IE/AE) which had been invited till 01.05.2017, the NHAI may continue with the practice followed in the past whereby that award of consultancy may be considered against a single responsive financial bid if the amount quoted therein is found to be reasonable. For this purpose, a ceiling upto one percent of the project cost was considered to be reasonable. (ii) As per the future, since the time taken in the completion of the bid process for consulting services is a major concern, it was decided that the complete system functionalities provided under INFRACON should be followed s0 as to reduce the processing time. It is further decided that a uniform practice should be adopted in respect of bids for consulting assignments and Award of Civil Work Road Projects i.e. in the case of a single responsive bid in the first call, bid should be re-invited. However _ in case a single responsive bid is received even against the Call, the same may be accepted subject to reasonability of rates: 2_ This issues with the approval of Competent Authority: (A.K; Sadhu) Chief General Manager (Coord) To All Officers of HQROs/PIUs/CMUs/Site offices. 23rd 2nd
